definition: to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: Surely thou wilt not send me without a heart into another world?
sentences.chinese: 你定然不會不給我一顆心而將我送去另一個世界吧？

sentences.english: We'll certainly be hearing more from her.
sentences.chinese: 我們定然還會聽到更多關於她的新聞。

sentences.english: Well, kinetic energy has clearly increased.
Of course you think you know everything about sex.
sentences.chinese: 你定然覺得你什麼都知道。

sentences.english: Must be wandering in the Heaven Street.
If ye will not believe, surely ye shall not be established.
sentences.chinese: 你們若是不信，定然不得立穩。

sentences.english: Thou canst not think how strange a people they are.
sentences.chinese: 你定然想不到他們是怎樣一個稀奇的民族。

sentences.english: If you do not stand firm in your faith, you will not stand at all.
sentences.chinese: 你們若是不信，定然不得立穩。

sentences.english: At this time has been dispersed, however they will then leapt out unexpectedly.
sentences.chinese: 此時已經散去，然而它們定然會再躥出來攻其不備。

definition: to be bound to/to be sure to
were it not for/if not for
to expect/to presume/to think (sth is likely)
hard to say/can't guarantee/difficult to protect/difficult to preserve
